pytorch_privacy.dp_query.dp_query module¶

class pytorch_privacy.dp_query.dp_query.DPQuery[source]¶

Bases: abc.ABC

General class for a query applied to data in a DP fashion. Terminology derived from definitions in https://arxiv.org/abs/1812.06210

abstract accumulate_preprocessed_record(sample_state, record)[source]¶

Accumulate a single record into the current sample state.

Does simple aggregation of the recodrs, usually just summing.

Parameters

sample_state – The current sample state e.g. in DP-SGD the accumulated

clipped gradients so far. :param record: The new record to accumulate. :return: The updated sample state.

accumulate_record(params, sample_state, record)[source]¶

Accumulate a new record into the sample state.

Simple delegation function to other defined functions.

Parameters

  • params – The sample parameters, e.g. clipping bound in DP-SGD.

  • sample_state – The current sample state.

  • record – The new record to accumulate.

Returns

The updated sample state with extra information about the record

derive_sample_params(global_state)[source]¶

Given some global state, derive the parameters to use for the next sample.

Parameters

global_state – A global state of the DPQuery.

:return Parameters to use in the next sample.

abstract get_noised_result(sample_state, global_parameters)[source]¶

Applies privacy noise after all the samples have been accumulated :param sample_state: The accumulated sample stata :param global_parameters: The current global parameters :return: A tuple (results, new_global_state) that contains the result of the query and the new query global state

initial_global_state()[source]¶

Initial state for the global settings of the DPQuery.

abstract initial_sample_state(param_groups)[source]¶

Returns an initial state to use at the start of the next sample.

Parameters

param_groups – The param_groups to use as a template for the blank state.

Returns

An initial sample state.

abstract merge_sample_states(sample_state_1, sample_state_2)[source]¶

Merges two sample_states together.

Parameters

  • sample_state_1 – The first sample state.

  • sample_state_2 – The second sample state.

Returns

The merged sample states.

preprocess_record(params, record)[source]¶

Preprocess a single record.

Applies to a single clients record, this could be clipping a vector to a fixed L2 norm. :param params: The parameters for this sample, in DP-SGD, the L2 bound. :param record: The record to process, in DP-SGD, a single mircobatch gradient. :return: A structure of tensors to apply.

set_ledger(ledger)[source]¶

Sets the ledger for this query to record privacy events in. :param ledger: A ‘PrivacyLedger’.

class pytorch_privacy.dp_query.dp_query.SumAggregationDPQuery[source]¶

Bases: pytorch_privacy.dp_query.dp_query.DPQuery

Base class for when a DPQuery aggregates via summation

accumulate_preprocessed_record(sample_state, record)[source]¶

Accumulate a single record into the current sample state.

Does simple aggregation of the recodrs, usually just summing.

Parameters

sample_state – The current sample state e.g. in DP-SGD the accumulated

clipped gradients so far. :param record: The new record to accumulate. :return: The updated sample state.

initial_sample_state(param_groups)[source]¶

Return state of zeros the same shape as the parameter groups.

merge_sample_states(sample_state_1, sample_state_2)[source]¶

Merges two sample_states together.

Parameters

  • sample_state_1 – The first sample state.

  • sample_state_2 – The second sample state.

Returns

The merged sample states.
